definitions: Long, slender, non-motile extensions of the apical surface of some epithelial cells, notably the hair cells of the inner ear, where they play a crucial role in hearing and balance.
Mechanosensing organelles of hair cells, which respond to fluid motion in the inner ear by deflecting and opening ion channels.
examples: Damage to stereocilia can lead to hearing loss.
The stereocilia in the cochlea are arranged in rows.
Movement of the stereocilia triggers an electrical signal.
